meanings.definition: A British coin worth two pennies.
meanings.sent1: I found a tuppence on the street.
meanings.sent2: She paid for the candy with a tuppence.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel saved up tuppence to buy nuts.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were worth more than a tuppence.
meanings.sent5: The tuppence shone in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A very small amount of money.
meanings.sent1: He didn't have a tuppence to spare.
meanings.sent2: She saved every tuppence she earned.
meanings.sent3: The cat's toy cost only a tuppence.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was worth more than a tuppence.
meanings.sent5: The tuppence jingled in his pocket.
